pr_title: Don't crash SDK is socket.close() fails

timeline.message: Don't crash SDK is socket.close() fails

timeline.bodyText: catching Throwable seems a little bit aggressive as it will also catch java.lang.Errors which, according to its javadoc, "a reasonable application should not try to catch". Would it be sufficient to only catch Exception for example?
timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: Fixed. I only mean to catch IOException and NPEs here.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian
